reviewText: Reviewing an old movie was refreshing from today's movies, however it was somewhat silly.
Rosalind Russell, all grown up and soooo stylishly 1949 ... loved it.
they should make movies like this still just loved it soo funny
Lots of talent but I'd only grade it a B at best because it's the talent that is great, not the story
very funny

Rosalind Russell comedies are always fun to watch; but this plot and script is weak.  The movie is amusing and will provide something to watch when bored; but it is not worth the $2.99 for instant viewing.  Some of these older lesser-known films should be offered at 99 cents.
Love the classics , this was nice Russell is always good, as is Cummings. Love to watching old movies especially comedies and love stories and not worry about fast forwarding...

If you like the old screwball comedies and Rosalind Russell's voice you will love this movie. She and her husband have just been divorced but he is trying desperately to win her back. The woman who was the cause of the divorce (a beautiful blonde) and Rosalind's interfering uncle keep popping in every time it seems they are back on solid ground. Funny (predictable) circumstances, fast moving, silliness. I love watching the old movies if you like reminiscing about the fifties, checking out the fashions and hearing the music. This one is enjoyable but with only two main characters, a little tiring by the end.

Russell at her best, comedy with romance! Robert Cummings is excellent as the ex-husband trying to get Russell back in this zany comedy. Enjoy Hollywood in its finest decade.

Andy
DVD could not be played - was not usable unfortunately.  Do not recommend this one as I was not able to view  it.  The DVD I received appeared to be defective.
This is one of my favorite movies. Bob Cummings and Rosalind Russell are perfect together.  It's funny and quick paced the whole time, and never fails to entertain my family and friends.
Good story

If you like Rosalind Russell (and I do), you'll like this movie. She's smart--she's the judge to tell it to--glamorous, funny and fearless--she gets completely drenched, with no complaints. Even though there are still jibes about staying home like a good wife, she holds her own, determined to be a judge. I thought the movie was a lot of fun.
One of Rosalind Russell's funniest!
This movie was okay, but not one of their best.
Great dialogue and slapstick!
Great thanks
Dated but fun.
Well done! Super funny!
What can I say?  Rosalind Russell, anything is good.
